body.p:
June 15th 1863
Bushes Store
Laurel Co, Ky
To, his Exclincy
G. W. Roberson
Gov. of Kentucky

Sir Thy is a -- find in my offices a gainst Thos Tuttle for striking Harris on credit the facts are these Cardell -- went in to the field where Tuttle was at wark with & took Tuttles horse from -- him & Tuttl=had him arrested & in arresting the said Cordel Tuttle struck him but did not hurt him cordel was Tride & is on bail & he had Tuttle arrested for striking him & the Jury find Tuttle $10, Tuttle is a --
union man -- & cordel is a -- horse Rogue Tuttle had bin driving the government waggons for six months & came home & boght a horse so make a crop & cordel under sick so steel it, under -- those circumstances he petitions your -- Exclency to Remit the find against the said Thos Tuttle that in my office Tuttle is an orphan boy & is so harm & &discret; & hard working & a poor boy & it would be a deed of charity to Remit the fine the a-bove facts are -- True I am yours Respectfully John Maris, J -- P
Should you see proper to Remit the fines you can address Thos Tuttle at Bushes Store Laurel County, Ky --
W I Crook one of the Jury. Dan Williams Sias Jackson --

Laurel J. P. Ct
Fine remitted
J F Robinson
"Tho. Tuttle"
$10 } Mis.
Issd June 23. 1863
